content: Great to hear! To start, how have you been feeling lately?

Honestly, I've been feeling really low. I feel overwhelmed and stuck. Things with my wife and son have been tough, and it just feels like everything is falling apart. I want to fix it, but I don’t even know where to start.

That sounds tough, and it’s clear that you’re carrying a lot right now. Feeling overwhelmed and stuck can make it hard to see a way forward. Wanting to fix things shows how much you care. Can you share a bit more about what’s been happening with your wife and son?

My wife and I have been arguing more than ever, mostly about how to handle our son. He’s been acting out a lot—tantrums, refusing to listen—and no matter what we try, it feels like we’re failing as parents. It’s putting so much strain on our marriage, and I worry about how this might be affecting my daughter too.

That sounds like such a heavy situation to be in—navigating the challenges with your son while also trying to protect your relationship with your wife and consider your daughter's well-being. It really highlights just how invested you are in your family. How are you managing to cope with all of this?

Honestly, I don’t think I’m managing it well at all. I feel like I’m just going through the motions, but I’m not really present. I’m drained all the time—at work, at home, everywhere—and even the things I used to enjoy don’t seem to help anymore.

Feeling so drained and disconnected must be incredibly difficult. It sounds like you're running on empty and finding it hard to engage with daily life and the things that once brought you joy. What would you say is the biggest obstacle keeping you from feeling more present or connected right now?

I think it’s all the stress and guilt I’m carrying. Between my son’s behavior, my wife and I fighting, and feeling like I’m neglecting my daughter—I’m overwhelmed. It’s hard to focus on anything else when it feels like everything is falling apart.

Carrying that much stress and guilt must feel incredibly heavy, especially when you care so deeply about your family. It sounds like you’re trying to juggle everyone’s needs while also dealing with your own feelings of overwhelm. What do you think might help lift some of that weight, even just a little bit?
